intro: Corydalis sheareri f. bulbillifera, commonly known as the bulbillifera corydalis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fumariaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, branched stems and clusters of small, pink to purple flowers. The plant produces bulbils, which are small vegetative propagules that allow for asexual reproduction. Native to the mountainous regions of China, it thrives in cool, moist environments. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in specialty gardens and botanical collections.
